title: Russia's Putin plans to visit Israel in January 2020
text:
FILE PHOTO: Russian President Vladimir Putin attends a meeting with his Iranian counterpart Hassan Rouhani in Ankara, Turkey September 16, 2019. Sputnik/Alexei Nikolsky/Kremlin via REUTERS

MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Tuesday he planned to visit Israel in January next year to inaugurate a memorial to World War Two victims in Jerusalem.

Putin also told a meeting with a Jewish charity fund on Tuesday that Russia is paying a “high attention” to developing mutually beneficial relations with Israel.
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Tuesday he planned to visit Israel in January next year to inaugurate a memorial to World War Two victims in Jerusalem.
